uk.ac.ebi.jmzml.model.mzml

Class BinaryDataArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.jmzml.model.mzml.MzMLObject
      • uk.ac.ebi.jmzml.model.mzml.ParamGroup
        • uk.ac.ebi.jmzml.model.mzml.BinaryDataArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class BinaryDataArray
extends ParamGroup
implements java.io.Serializable
    The structure into which encoded binary data goes. Byte ordering is always little endian (Intel style). Computers using a different endian style must convert to/from little endian when writing/reading mzML

    Java class for BinaryDataArrayType complex type.

    The following schema fragment specifies the expected content contained within this class. 

     <complexType name="BinaryDataArrayType">
   <complexContent>
     <extension base="{http://psi.hupo.org/ms/mzml}ParamGroupType">
       <sequence>
         <element name="binary" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}base64Binary"/>
       </sequence>
       <attribute name="arrayLength" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}nonNegativeInteger" />
       <attribute name="dataProcessingRef" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}IDREF" />
       <attribute name="encodedLength" use="required" type="{http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}nonNegativeInteger" />
     </extension>
   </complexContent>
 </complexType>
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  BinaryDataArray.Precision
      Enumeration defining the allowed precision cases for the binary data as defined in the mzML specifications and the PSI-MS ontology.

        public DataProcessing getDataProcessing()

        Returns:
        Valid values are DataProcessing objects.
        See Also:

      • setDataProcessing

        public void setDataProcessing(DataProcessing dataProcessing)
        Retrieve the binary data as array of numeric values. the dataProcessingRef element with the id from the new DataProcessing object.
        Parameters:
        dataProcessing - the DataProcessing to reference from this BinaryDataArray.
        See Also:
        dataProcessingRef

        Sets the value of the encodedLength property.
        Parameters:
        value - allowed object is Integer

      • getBinaryDataAsNumberArray

        public java.lang.Number[] getBinaryDataAsNumberArray()
        Retrieve the binary data as array of numeric values. The type (double, float, long, int) of the values is determined by the according CVParam of this BinaryDataArray. The CVParams will also be used to determine if the data first needs uncompressing.
        Returns:
        a Number array representation of the binary data.

      • getBinaryDataAsString

        public java.lang.String getBinaryDataAsString()
                                       throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Converts the binary data representing the "null-terminated ASCII string" into a Java String. The method to use if the attached CVParam defines the binary data as "null-terminated ASCII string".
        Returns:
        the String constructed from the binary data.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the expected encoding (ASCII) is not supported.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the method is used on binary data and the accompanying CVParams state that the data does not represent a "null-terminated ASCII string".
        See Also:
        getPrecision()

      • set64BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData

        public int set64BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData(double[] value,
                                 boolean compress,
                                 CV cv)
        Sets the value of the binary property for data in double values. Note that double values imply a precision of 64 bit.
        Parameters:
        value - the data as double array.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.

      • set32BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData

        public int set32BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData(float[] value,
                                 boolean compress,
                                 CV cv)
        Sets the value of the binary property for data in float values. Note that float values imply a precision of 32 bit.
        Parameters:
        value - the data as float array.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.

      • set32BitIntArrayAsBinaryData

        public int set32BitIntArrayAsBinaryData(int[] array,
                               boolean compress,
                               CV cv)
        Sets the value of the binary property for data in int values. Note that int values imply a precision of 32 bit.
        Parameters:
        array - the data as int array.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.

      • set64BitIntArrayAsBinaryData

        public int set64BitIntArrayAsBinaryData(long[] array,
                               boolean compress,
                               CV cv)
        Sets the value of the binary property for data in long values. Note that long values imply a precision of 64 bit.
        Parameters:
        array - the data as long array.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.

      • setStringAsBinaryData

        public int setStringAsBinaryData(java.lang.String value,
                        boolean compress,
                        CV cv)
                          throws java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        Sets the value of the binary property for data represented as String. Note: since Java does not have the concept of "null terminated strings", this will add a null byte to comply with the mzML specifications.
        Parameters:
        value - the String value of the binary data.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.
        Throws:
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding (ASCII) used by the String methods is not supported.

      • setNumberArrayAsBinaryData

        public int setNumberArrayAsBinaryData(java.lang.Number[] array,
                             BinaryDataArray.Precision p,
                             boolean compress,
                             CV cv)
        Sets the value of the binary property for data in Number values. Since Number can hold all other number data, the precision has to be specified.
        Parameters:
        array - the Number array holding the data.
        p - the Precision defining the data format.
        compress - flag whether or not the data should be compressed.
        cv - The CV that will be used as reference CV for the generated compression and precision CVParams.
        Returns:
        an int value specifying the length of the byte[] that was stored as binary data.
        See Also:
        set32BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData(float[], boolean, CV), set64BitFloatArrayAsBinaryData(double[], boolean, CV), set32BitIntArrayAsBinaryData(int[], boolean, CV), set64BitIntArrayAsBinaryData(long[], boolean, CV)

      • getPrecision

        public BinaryDataArray.Precision getPrecision()
        Retrieve the precision from the CVParams of this BinaryDataArray and report the found precision as BinaryDataArray.Precision.
        Returns:
        the Precision defined by the CVParams accompanying this BinaryDataArray.

      • needsUncompressing

        public boolean needsUncompressing()
        Reads the CVParams of this BinaryDataArray object and reports true if the according CVParam was found stating that the binary data is compressed.
        Returns:
        true if the attached CVParams contain a parameter stating that the data is compressed. False is returned if the CVParam for uncompressed data is found.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if none of the expected CVParams were found.
